Und das alles für läppische 18€!

This game is great, beats the heck out of most zombie games, with a very dark atmosphere...IT WILL MAKE YOU JUMP. Zombies/Mutants always find their way behind you somehow, especially while you are reloading...You start off with basic weapons, after every wave of zombies a trader opens up shop where you can buy or trade weapons...you level up perks through gameplay granting you special discounts on weapons in the traders shop allowing you to purchase anything from a machine gun to a samurai sword. OH YEAH, and no crosshairs- using the guns actual sights to get headshots is way more rewarding then some pink or purple crosshair. TONS of different zombie/mutant types to kill, lots of very cool maps, plenty of dedicated fans online to play with, and an SDK to create your own content...buying this game is a must.

A really fun co-op FPS to play with friends and random players. It's simple and sometimes repetitive but that's part of the charm, at least there's maps added consistently and the enemies change appearance during different times of the year. Tons of weapons, violence, and all in a dark, gritty, English world.

+ Tons of fun
+ Hacking away at enemies with melee is a blast
+ Challenging on almost all difficulty levels
+ Graphics are still nice
+ Dark setting
+ Tons of characters to play as
+ Class XP applies no matter the class you play as
+ Class bonuses only work when you are that class (so class matters)
+ Loads of content
+ Steam Workshop
+ MONEY MONEY MONEY!

- Almost overwhelming amount of content shoved at you at once

Not only is this an addictive, infinitely replayable cooperative shooter, with some RPG-lite elements, but it has an incredibly supportive development team and community, which continue to provide free maps, weapons, perks, achievements, and even enemy types.  For its very low dollar value, you are getting a lot of gameplay and hours of enjoyment.  Highly recommended for shooter fans and those who love co-op games!

Ahí hay una errata, pone Co-Op Survival Horror, pero yo lo llamaría Co-Op Survival Arcade, porque los bichos no dan miedo. Además, ¿a quién le dan miedo los monstruos eunucos? ¡Porque míralos! ¡Van desnudos y no tienen genitales! Y sí, también hay zombis femeninas, pero no se les ve nada porque llevan esparadrapo.
No obstante, el ritmo frenético de este juego es su gran baza, y si a eso le añadimos que algunos han recreado niveles del DOOM el juego gana puntos gracias a la comunidad. La verdad es que no está mal, no es lo mejor pero sí es muy divertido.

Killing Floor leva a idéia de suvival ao sentido literal. Aqui o jogador deve simplesmente sobreviver as hordas de monstros em diferentes mapas, cada um com espaço para estratégias diferentes. Com um sistema de perks (como classes ou "jobs") em que o jogador adquire vantagens sobre os equipamentos que compram na loja (que abre a cada intervalo entre as "waves" (ou hordas, ou rushs, como preferirem), e cada perk evolui de forma única, algumas utilizando armas da perk, outros atingindo certos objetivos como matar alguns experimentos certas vezes. Killing floor também conta com um combate intenso, não há "crossair" (ou mira), obrigando o jogador a utilizar o ironsight (ou a mira da própria arma) que deixa o jogador mais lento, porém com maior precisão no disparo. Se você busca um jogo survival com armas realistas e com necessidade de teamplay, Killing Floor é uma excelente sugestão.

DOSH: THE GAME is a co-op arena zombie FPS. Kinda like a cross between Left4Dead and Alien Swarm. The only objective is to survive waves of zombies till you finally encounter the Patriarch, the zombie father--the final wave. It has a versatile perks system--everyone can use any weapon, and so can level up any given perk regardless of which perk you are. However, whichever perk you choose has special benefits. Compralo cuando este en oferta y no te arrepentirás, es tiempo de matar, es tiempo de killing floor.

Если у вас есть несколько друзей, а L4D уже надоела, то Killing Floor - прекрасная замена. Эта игра не требует невероятного умения игры, так как в ней нет сражения игрока против игрока. А работа в команде и взаимодействие разных классов здесь - залог победы. Ну и фирменное Tripwire'овское внимание  к проработке оружия, эстеты оценят. Разве что Unreal Engine 2.5 даёт о себе знать иногда растворяющимися в воздухе трупами, но всё это мелочи по сравнению с ощущениями от игры. А теперь появился и дополнительный повод её купить - шапки в Team Fortress 2.

Probably the single greatest team co-op FPS i've ever played (high praise indeed!) Due in no small part to the continued dedication and support of the team that made it. The game as it exists now has so much more content than was released originally, and for the maps the extra weapons the new class and extra perk levels the guys at tripwire have charged players not a penny more than whatever you originally paid...
The game is fast-paced, brutal, and highly theraputic. Go and check out a video or two to get an idea of just how hectic games can get, then buy this next time a sale comes around - it will be money well spent :)

Wave based zombie killing at it's finest.  It's very challenging, has upgradeable perks, a nice variety of weapons and baddies, and a nice helping of buttrock in the background.  If you're looking for something with a bit more meat to it than Left 4 Dead's survival mode, this is what you're after.

Often unfairly discarded as a Left 4 Dead clone, people who do decide to venture into this little gem will be pleasantly surprised. Based on an old mod for UT2k4, this game is by no means trying to ride the wave of L4D's success but rather paving it's own way into the Survival Horror genre. You will find yourself battling varied hordes of experiments with up to 5 friends (Total: 6 :) ) with an epic boss battle at the end. The levelling is a nice addition and doesn't distract too much from the game. Overall an enjoyble survival game. Contact me if you want to play with some bros, we have our own server and play as a team :)

Pros:
- A great experience with friends
- Repetitive, but great every time
- All difficulties play fair
- Perks let you set up tatics with your team

Cons:
- The voices are really annoying
- Wish it wasn't trying to get some sort of  "angst" into the game
- Game relies too much on how high your perks are sometimes
- Takes a long and annoying time to level up your perks

Overall:
I don't have too strong of complaints for this game, I feel overall it delievers what it wanted to, while it could've used a bit more work, but hey, they're fixing that right now as I type

Like fighting massive amounts of undead and/or demonic forces? Have the need to take out your aggressions with a shotgun? Do you like "MONEY"? Then you should get off your duff and PLAY this game. Get Killing Floor no seriously get Killing Floor, there are those who say that I can remove a human spleen through the eye socket.  If you don't want to find out first hand you should get Killing Floor.  It's a nice wave based zombie game, and while the husks do get annoying at times due to the ability to snipe you from behind a tree 200 meters out through a fence, the rest of the mechanics are nice.  Besides, we need more people on there who actually know what they are doing.  I'm getting really tired of dealing with level 1s and 2s on suicidal without the foggiest notion of what the classes even mean (e.g. a sharpshooter running around with a katana FTL).  So yeah get Killing Floor and I will be most grateful.  Also, I won't have to send the piranha to come get you.

[u][b]November 2010 Review:[/b][/u]
I have never played this game. I don't know a thing about it. I wouldn't be able to advise you on expert tips, like the Crossbow has a 7.8x multiplier for headshots, or the Scrake is resistant to explosives, but vulnerable to the Katana. I don't even know what a Scrake is, or that he has a chainsaw for an arm. All I can tell you, is that anyone who has played this for 700+ hours, must be a psychopath, who obviously enjoys killing zombies way too much. I would be wary of such people, unless of course you have a penchant for similiar activities. If that is the case, you will enjoy this game ...... or at least, that is what I have been told, because I wouldn't know?


[u][b]November 2015 Addendum:[/b][/u]
Now that I have reached 9999.9 hours, what label could be used to describe me, if a [i]"psychopath"[/i] is only 700+ hours?

Malcolm Gladwell has eminently suggested, 10000 hours of practice is necessary to [i]'master'[/i] a pursuit. Throughout the 6 years of playing Killing Floor, I have observed my performance improve steadily.  When I reached the 4k hour mark, I felt I was becoming one of the better players in the game.  At 6k hours, I expected my performance to plateau, but every 1000 hours thereafter, I still noted refinement in my style and I was surprised by this. After 9k hours, I was completing tasks that I couldn't imagine possible, even after the fact.  Players were questioning if I could die.  Even I began to wonder, but after testing with a couple of grenades: yep, I can still die!

With 6 more minutes of gameplay, I should acknowledge Mr Gladwell's theory, with a quote from another Darth and say [i]"the circle is now complete .... now I am the master"[/i]!  A noble mentor, such as Obi Wan Kenobi, would ponder the effect of Killing Floor and comeback with [i]"only a master of evil, Darth"[/i].  Perhaps that is what someone should be called, if they have 10000 hours of Killing Floor gameplay; a [b]"master of evil"[/b]!  I should go with Obi's wisdom and save my soul.   I should NOT play that final six minutes!  [i]The circle is not complete! You have failed Tripwire Interactive, I (still) am a 'noob-i'![/i]


[u][b]November 2017 Addendum:[/b][/u]
Twenty four months after last playing Killing Floor, I thought I'd reminisce and have a little fun.  Why not play that final six minutes and become the game's [b]"master of evil"[/b]?  I thought to myself; [i]"it is my destiny"[/i]!

While browsing online matches, I noticed a few servers used mutators that allowed unlimited ammo, health and armor that regenerated .... What!?  There were enough of these that I wondered why. Could they actually be whitelisted (i.e. exploit servers)?  I had hoped Tripwire Interactive would never do this, but have they now?  To confirm, I killed some stalkers with a Bullpup and my stats were retained after I left the server; these mutators were indeed whitelisted!  I was horrified, but not surprised, because Killing Floor is just money to Tripwire (the company was sold by the original creator years ago) and they have no pride in software that's been purchased by everyone already.  I feel they sabotaged KF, so that players would be more inclined to try the sequel (KF2), which many have told me is a disappointment.

I could only find one legitimate higher difficulty server in the whole world; a Suicidal game with a ping of 400!  I held my own, but I felt unsure what to do.  It was my muscle memory that covered for me and I was able to contribute to the win despite feeling lost.  The Patriarch was '[i]locked[/i]' by me with a ping of 400; it felt ridiculous and strange!  It was an uncomfortable experience, watching your body play, while your conscious mind spectates.  Afterwards, I played on a local server on Hard.  Someone actually recognised me here, but I didn't know who they were.  I found the game boring and after completing the next wave I left.

My brief reminisce is not to say I think Killing Floor is awful; it is still a remarkable accomplishment, despite it now being owned by people who do not care for the software's integrity.  For me, I've clearly played this game for too long – well obviously! – 10001 hours now.  The time I've played however, reflects Killing Floor's ability to keep you immersed in it's challenges – that is of course, if it's played the way it was meant to be, rather than using whitelisted cheat servers.

-Core Review-

Gameplay . 6 (with friends 8) average = 7
Music . 8
Art . 7 (outdated)
Mechanics . 6 (outdated)

Total . 7


-Nice Words-

Killing floor is a fine game if you want to grab some friends and kill thousands of mutants. The music is very intense and surprisingly fitting to the game itself. Art style is a little old now, considering the game itself is a little old now. However it is perfectly fine for what the game is. Mechanics are old, the engine is old, the game is old, old old old. YES it's old, but good! mm back to mechanics, yes they are old, yet it is extremely satisfying to blow mutants heads off, or chop their limbs off in slow-mo. Over-all it is a great game to play with your buddies. I would recommend it to anyone who likes gore, and killing lots of things in short amounts of time.

Still, get it on sale.


-Personal Experience-

I had just gotten out of playing L4D2 for a while and I was in the mood for another zombie-like shoot em up. So naturally when my friend Michael suggested this game to me, I hopped on board very quickly. Not knowing what to do was half the fun, and exploring about the game, learning the different maps and different perks was an experience on its own. For the first 20 or so hours I never even fought the boss, but when I did, man I was not ready.

When the first of the events started that was a real blast and every event after that was something nice to come back to and try to complete. Now however I'm running out of custom maps to play and events to do. The workshop addition is nice, organized way of offering skins and maps, but I am definitely more excited for the release of Killing Floor 2.

This game has grown more of a classic to me now, after so many hours of playing, I occasionally go back to play it, and it never disappoints. All I hope is that Killing Floor 2 will be better than this game, from what I've seen it looks like it will be the same stuff over again, with updated mechanics and (slightly) upgraded graphics. In which case, I will not be playing it.

Cooperative zombie survival game. Term that often gets thrown around without much consideration and often seems to dissapoint. Fortunantly, this is not the case with Killing Floor. Been playing it since release and never had a bad trip. Easy to use map editor, large community with mostly friendly and cooperative players, and one badass boss waiting to fuck you over. Upgradable perks give a reason to keep coming back and allow every player to perfect his or her own playstyle.

Enjoyed this game so much, I bought every dlc, frequent the Tripwire forums, and gifted several copies to strangers.
